prompt: Gulf of Mannar Biosphere Reserve is in:
explanation: Gulf of Mannar Biosphere Reserve is in Tamil Nadu. It includes coral reefs, seagrass beds, and mangrove and is known for marine biodiversity.
Sundarbans spans India (West Bengal) and Bangladesh. It is the largest mangrove forest and a UNESCO World Heritage Site and Biosphere Reserve.

prompt: Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve is in:
explanation: Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve is in Uttarakhand. It includes the Nanda Devi and Valley of Flowers National Parks.
Valley of Flowers National Park is in Uttarakhand. It is known for alpine flowers and is part of the Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve.
Simlipal National Park and Tiger Reserve is in Odisha. It is part of Simlipal Biosphere Reserve.
Panna Tiger Reserve is in Madhya Pradesh. It was known for tiger reintroduction after local extinction.
Kanha National Park (Kanha Kisli) is in Madhya Pradesh. It is a major Tiger Reserve and inspiration for Kipling's Jungle Book setting.
Bandhavgarh National Park is in Madhya Pradesh. It has a high density of tigers and is a popular Tiger Reserve.
Pench Tiger Reserve spans Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra. The Pench River flows through it; it inspired the setting of The Jungle Book.
Jim Corbett National Park / Corbett Tiger Reserve is in Uttarakhand. It was the first national park in India (1936).
Dudhwa National Park is in Uttar Pradesh. It is a Tiger Reserve and known for barasingha and other wildlife.

answers: Tiger reintroduction after poaching led to local extinction
explanation: Sariska (Rajasthan) lost its entire tiger population to poaching. Tigers were later reintroduced from Ranthambore.

prompt: Asiatic cheetah was declared extinct in India in:
explanation: The Asiatic cheetah was declared extinct in India in 1952. Cheetah reintroduction project has brought African cheetahs to India (e.g. Kuno).

prompt: Project Snow Leopard was launched to conserve:
answers: Snow leopard and its high-altitude habitat
explanation: Project Snow Leopard (2009) aims to conserve the snow leopard and its habitat in the Himalayan and trans-Himalayan regions.

prompt: One-horned rhinoceros is found in India in:
answers: Mainly Assam (Kaziranga, Pobitora, etc.); also WB (Jaldapara, Gorumara)
explanation: The greater one-horned rhinoceros is found in Assam (Kaziranga, Pobitora, Manas, etc.) and in West Bengal (Jaldapara, Gorumara).

answers: Critically endangered crocodilian (long snout); found in rivers like Chambal
explanation: Gharial is a critically endangered crocodilian with a long, narrow snout. It inhabits clean rivers like the Chambal. Conservation programmes are ongoing.

answers: Freshwater dolphin in Ganga-Brahmaputra; endangered; national aquatic animal
explanation: The Ganges river dolphin (Platanista gangetica) is a freshwater dolphin in the Ganga-Brahmaputra system. It is India's national aquatic animal and endangered.
Nilgiri tahr is an endangered mountain ungulate endemic to the Western Ghats (Tamil Nadu, Kerala).
Sangai or brow-antlered deer is endemic to Manipur. It is found in Keibul Lamjao National Park (floating phumdi ecosystem).

prompt: Great Indian bustard is critically endangered and found in:
answers: Rajasthan, Gujarat, Maharashtra (grasslands); conservation efforts ongoing
explanation: The great Indian bustard is critically endangered. Its remaining population is mainly in Rajasthan (Desert NP) and small numbers in Gujarat and Maharashtra.
